info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 10 at 7:11PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW WILL BRING HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS THIS EVENING... A Winter Weather Advisory remains in effect for all of north central and far northeast Wisconsin. A band of snow over north central Wisconsin will overspread far northeast Wisconsin between 8 pm and 10 pm. The snow will become moderate to heavy at times, though only for a few hours at any given location. The heaviest snow is expected to occur between now and 11 pm in north central Wisconsin, and between 10 pm and 2 am in far northeast Wisconsin. Snowfall totals of 2 to 4 inches can be expected, though locally higher amounts are possible. The combination of intense snowfall rates, poor visibilities, some blowing snow, and snow covered roads, will lead to hazardous travel conditions this evening and into the early overnight hours. The precipitation will taper off to a mix of light snow showers and freezing drizzle overnight, though icing impacts should be minimized due to the snow covered surfaces. Anyone planning travel tonight will encounter hazardous road conditions. Slow down, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
